channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: ADHD drugs may work indirectly to boost attention
item.description: Drugs like Adderall and Ritalin appear to help children with ADHD by activating brain areas involved in alertness and motivation.
item.content:encoded:
Drugs like Adderall and Ritalin appear to help children with ADHD by activating brain areas involved in alertness and motivation.

(Image credit: Benjamin Kay)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Russia attacks Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-US talks
item.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Myanmar is set to hold phased elections. Here's why they're being called a 'sham'
item.description: Myanmar's military rulers are holding a general election in phases starting Dec. 28 amid the country's civil war. The head of the U.N. says the vote will be anything but free and fair.
item.content:encoded:
Myanmar's military rulers are holding a general election in phases starting Dec. 28 amid the country's civil war. The head of the U.N. says the vote will be anything but free and fair.

(Image credit: Aung Shine Oo)
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan

item.title: Judge to hold hearing on whether Kilmar Abrego Garcia is being vindictively prosecuted
item.description: A federal judge this week canceled the trial of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, and scheduled a hearing on whether the prosecution is being vindictive in pursuing a human smuggling case against him.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge this week canceled the trial of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, and scheduled a hearing on whether the prosecution is being vindictive in pursuing a human smuggling case against him.

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign new ceasefire agreement to end border fighting
item.description: In addition to ending fighting, the agreement calls for no further military movements by either side and no violations of either side's airspace for military purposes.
item.content:encoded:
In addition to ending fighting, the agreement calls for no further military movements by either side and no violations of either side's airspace for military purposes.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Top Instagram reels from Goats and Soda in 2025: Plumpy'Nut, aid cuts, soccer grannies
item.description: Our most-viewed Instagram videos include reports from a Rhode Island factory that makes special food for malnourished children and from a tournament for soccer-playing "grannies."
item.content:encoded:
Our most-viewed Instagram videos include reports from a Rhode Island factory that makes special food for malnourished children and from a tournament for soccer-playing "grannies."

(Image credit: From left: Ryan Brown for NPR; Diaa Hadid/NPR; Gabrielle Emanuel/NPR; Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: U.S. strikes ISIS in Nigeria. And, holiday shopping was higher than expected
item.description: The U.S. has launched a "deadly strike" against Islamic State fighters in northwest Nigeria, according to Trump. And, holiday spending was higher than expected this year.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has launched a "deadly strike" against Islamic State fighters in northwest Nigeria, according to Trump. And, holiday spending was higher than expected this year.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Should the U.S. model its vaccine policy on Denmark's? Experts say we're nothing alike
item.description: The Trump administration wants to revamp U.S. childhood vaccination recommendations to align with some other peer nations, including one tiny country in northern Europe.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration wants to revamp U.S. childhood vaccination recommendations to align with some other peer nations, including one tiny country in northern Europe.

(Image credit: Scott Barbour/Getty Images Europe)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Marijuana rescheduling would bring some immediate changes, but others will take time
item.description: President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: The cultural works becoming public domain in 2026, from Betty Boop to Nancy Drew
item.description: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.content:encoded: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
